results.title: First impressions
results.creator_credit: United States. Navy and Atlas Educational Films
results.brief_description: Made primarily to show how wartime office employees of the US Navy Department were to be introduced to their work by supervisors. Discusses reasons why new employees may not like their job and presents some primary steps in giving them a good first impression of their work.

results.title: First impressions
results.brief_description: This film is designed for use in training supervisors and junior managers in human relations problems. The film tells the story of two workers starting with a new firm. Both are looking forward to the work and believe that they now have the opportunity they have been looking for to make successful careers for themselves. The first part shows how frustration and disillusionment can arise through lack of care and thought on the part of the supervisor. It then shows how these bad impressions could have been avoided by proper handling of the situation.

results.title: First Fleet: rite of passage
results.creator_credit: Orana Films, First Fleet Re-enactment Company, Bill Leimbach, Michael Balson and Richard Dennison
results.brief_description: Produced to commemorate Australia’s Bicentenary (1988), this video captures the official First Fleet Reenactment Voyage in 200 minutes of action and adventure. Witness the trials and tribulations of the modern day voyagers who took part in the voyage from Portsmouth on 13 May 1987 to the spectacular finale on Sydney Harbour on Australia Day, 26 January 1988.

results.title: First encounters
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Smith, Karl McPhee and Ben Lewin
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Migrant experience”.
Deals with the initial experience of various ethnic groups as they encounter Australia’s developing society and culture particularly the nature of the welcome experienced. Addresses what it is like to change cultural milieux, how forms of prejudice fit within Australian history and examines where attitudes towards migrants have changed.

results.title: First days (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Slater Film Productions, Lesley Hammond and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: Looks at a school is South Australia where a policy of continual admission for five year olds is in operation. Shows the way in which the parents and the new child are put at ease by the principal and class. Indicates the sorts of adjustments required from both the new student and the teachers. Also looks at vertical and small groups, open plan classrooms and parental involvement. Written by Terry Jennings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Slater Film Productions, Lesley Hammond and Ron Saunders

results.title: First day
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar and Gordon Glenn
results.brief_description: The first day of school is a major step in the developmental process of children everywhere. This program follows 11 new starters from various religious, ethnic and socio-economic backgrounds on their first day of school. Tim, the child of a fourth generation farming family in the Mallee, Sarah from Melbourne’s Turkish community, Roland, only child going to school in Rose Bay, Sydney, twins Kate and Jessie, Isaac in Nimbin, Ashleigh from a new housing estate in Melbourne’s East, Matthew and Jessie, twins with special needs, Sam, heading to a one teacher school and Gurrupiya, a small school in North Eastern Arnhem Land. Parents, family and friends discuss how their children have been raised and how it has contributed to their eduction skills thus far. Features footage of children on their first day of school and the thoughts and emotions they are experiencing. Research co-ordinator: Annemarie O’Brien. Narrator: Gordon Glenn.

results.title: First contact
results.creator_credit: Arundel Productions, Bob Connolly, Robin Anderson and Dick Smith Adventure
results.brief_description: Documents the clash of two cultures that occurred in the 1930s when the people of the highlands of New Guinea encountered the first Europeans to enter their world. One of these Australians, Michael Leahy, took a movie camera with him.

constellations_other.name: Bob Connolly
constellations_other.description: Australian audiences just can't seem to get enough of exploring local governments, bureaucracy and politics, whether that's through documentaries or biting social satire.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Arundel Productions, Bob Connolly, Robin Anderson and Dick Smith Adventure
results.description: Documents the clash of two cultures that occurred in the 1930s when the people of the highlands of New Guinea encountered the first Europeans to enter their world - for an El Dorado. One of these Australians, Michael Leahy, took a movie camera with him, and so managed to capture on film the confrontation between one civilisation and the representatives of another.
description_for_label: Documents the clash of two cultures that occurred in the 1930s when the people of the highlands of New Guinea encountered the first Europeans to enter their world - for an El Dorado. One of these Australians, Michael Leahy, took a movie camera with him, and so managed to capture on film the confrontation between one civilisation and the representatives of another.
